Ein sehr lustiges wie auch brutals Spiel. 

Positiv :
- man kann es mit 3-4 weiteren Personen spielen 
- es gibt kein "Pay to win" 
- DLCs sind vom Preis her billig
- Die Community ist nicht so schlimm wie in anderen Spielen
- man kann selbst entscheiden ob man √úberlebenden oder Killer spielt
- Es gibt verschiedene Killer mit verschiedenen Skills 
- Es gibt Item 
- Es gibt Opfergaben 
- Es gibt verschiedene Maps 
- Es gibt immer mehr Contant (Killer, Maps u.s.w.)
 

Negativ :
- 15% - 30% der Killer campen (was nichts bringt)
- nach Freischalten aller Perks ist das spielen der √úberlebenden immer monoton
- Bugs
- es kann paranoid machen 
- Manche Perks sind zu stark andere wiederrum zu schwach 

Nach √ºber 1000 h Spielzeit in Dead by Daylight finde ich das es gelungen ist (trz den Bugs u.s.w) und ich hoffe das es immer mehr Contant hinzukommt.

^_^

My permanently locked review on this game..

So, let me start. DbD is meant to be fun multiplayer horror game with co-op and is good with friends and also played mostly with friends and well.. Guess what, you have to actually tryhard on this game and when you are having fun with friends... Experts will call you out for  enjoying playing, and thus you are ''being toxic'.' Well ofc you can have family friendly party but killer won't hesitate and will immidietly penetrate you. There's really not much grind and when i bought my first characters i thought i won't buy any more than that and hey i bought another 4 because the licensed DLC's are great (for sure i don't say this just because i'm life-less gamer without reason to spend money or anything else *cough* *cough*). I like the perks and mechanics but few of them feel somewhat old and for this reason, I've been suggesting several times some new ways to freshen this game to devs and hey, they actually listened and added at least breakable doors (one of the things i thought of) so i was satisfied.

[+] 
+ Original idea that is greatly executed with dedication from devs
+ Communicative Developers
+ Great atmosphere (only if you actually take some time to take this game seriously)
+ Really fun with friends 
+ Rewards are nice and especially when there is some event like xmas and i like that a lot so grinding levels and perks is kinda easy
+ Pretty nicely made mechanics, perks, graphics/visuals, playermodels, details
+ Licensed DLC's which are fun to play with
+Actually has entertaining lore

Now it's time for my less favorite part of this review

[-]
- Bugs, Lags, and it's a really annoying thing in this game
- Hitboxes feels like the killer hits you from different solar system
- From like rank 12 (don't know that equals in new gRadE system) it will give you feeling of 
  playing slot machine because you either get such bad teammates that you just can't just 
  CAN'T or on the other side, you'd get bad killer so 
  then it's only XP farming and that's not fun and it just gets boring and it is kind of based on 
  luck when you play soloQ
- Community just too bad and salty, not worth further discussions
- Not much enjoyable for new players because like i said, they will most likely get placed 
   poorly cuz of the ranking system and the tutorial just isn't helpful and it doesn't tell you the 
   REAL game rules like looping and juking, or something not really written like diff. roles in a 
   match that are in DbD.
- Gets kinda repetitive when you are expirienced player already and you know the 
  mechanics. They did add like breakable doors and the end game but they could add more 
  details that won't even hurt the game because you really then just play and play like in a 
  loop and you're just kinda hanging around and doing the same thing over and over even tho 
  you know that if you die you still escape. ''Death is not an escape'' btw. Would be cool thing 
  to add maybe like a really really quick skillcheck during the time killer found you in locker 
  would be enough to make og's like me happy idiots jumping on our wheelchairs
 
This game will be getting some big visual updates so it doesn't look that bad and i think that DbD community could actually finally bring new players and rise but please, don't play the same game as me if you are toxic twat :) thx. I enjoy playing it and i probably will but the ranking system and the bugs are pain and most of them are now for like the longest time in 
this game moreover when finally they fix some bugs, another appear so it's like a cursed cycle.


*8/10*  i still play this game and i will for a long time and i can say that i recommend this salty buggy thing called Dead by Hitbox :-)

il gioco in se √® bello, semplice e immediato... pero ho riscontrato delle cose abbastanza fastidiose, come ad esempio il fatto che ora ci siano 2 ganci attaccati l'un l'altro, rendendo praticamente inutile il divincolati e anche il perk che permetteva di sabotarli, perch√® si rigenerano col tempo... senza colpo decisivo √® quasi impossibile scappare alla presa del killer, poi in alcune mappe ci sono troppi pochi pancali, rendendo impossibile la fuga al sopravvisuto..
poi quando scavalca lento le finestre, anche tenendo lo shift inserito, agevola tantissimo il killer permettendogli di avvicinarsi molto, o addirittura di afferrarvi...
sento molto il bisogno in questo gioco di un aggiornamento che cambi qualcosa nell UI, magari semplificandola ed ottimizzandola al meglio, insomma una "ventata di aria fresca".
il nuovo sistema di rank √® carino ma √® assurdo che se uno fa tutti i gen non prenda il PIP per rankare, oppure mi √® capitato che in alcune partite nessuno √® stato preso (il killer non mi aveva mai trovato), e mi ha dato fuga 0 e benevolezza 0, da riguardare secondo me.

poi una cosa fondamentale...AGGIUNGETE JASON! 
√© uno dei killer PIU' CONOSCIUTI AL MONDO, magari personalizzabile coi vari vestiti indossati da Jason nei vari film, e in un gioco come questo secondo me ci sta tanto bene, sarebbe anche una bella innovazione.

poi io penso che bisognerebbe anche ottimizzare e rendere piu interessanti le animazioni in game, aggiungerne di nuove o migliorare quelle esistenti.

tutto sommato √® un gioco che consiglierei, da prendere scontato, ovviamente il gioco "agevola" il killer ed √® normale, va giocato con gli amici se si vuole fare il sopravvisuto, perch√® altrimenti morirete subito.
P.s in ogni caso sclereste

spero tanto in un aggiornamento che applichi le cose citate sopra, arrivderci e buon game!


aggiornamento 18 gougno 2019

il gioco di per se ora √® abbastanza bilanciato, solo che col killer qualche volta si trova gente di rango 8 quando magari da killer noi si √® rango 18 ma tutto sommato √® divertente

P.S il gioco da surviror, ma anche da killer, √® difficile, percui √® normale arrabbiarsi all inizio ma non si pu√≤ sempre vincere, col tempo migliorerete e state sicuri che trollando il killer vi divertirete (basti guardare zeb89 XD)

I just hit my 1200 hours played mark. Every hour I gain on this game it becomes more and more apparent to me that this game will remain in it's broken state forever. Every late hit after a pallet throw, every other lobby you join ends up freezing at the loading screen, every new game breaking bug that comes out with every "patch fix". I held out hope that at least one of the Dev's actually cares about our ideas and issues with the game, but there are bugs that are still in the game from when I started playing (Sep. of 2017).

I even went on McLean's Twitch while he was streaming today and asked, "Hey instead of rolling out a new killer / survivor this coming month, how about we get like 1GB+ of bug fixes." His response was this: "No brakes on the chapter train; choo choo." At first I just laughed it off. But judging how DbD is getting lower and lower in the browse section of Twitch, and DbD is on sale for $10 every other week, and the fact they keep cranking out money only clothing for characters, I have a feeling this game is going to come to an end soon. And they're just trying to scrap up some cash before it happens. Look what happened to Deathgarden. It lasted what a month?

I know Behaviour is a small Indie company. I get that. BUT there are some small Indie games that I've played that have received MUCH MORE love from their Devs (The Forest for example). Like I stated to McLean, if they just took a 3 month period off from coming up with some new killer everyones gonna hate and work on bug fixes, it would help the game go a long way. If this game was in Alpha or Beta, it would make a lot of sense. But to be this broken and be a full release? Shame.

I hope someone on the fence about this game reads this and decides not to join the toxic dump that is the DbD community. This game gives people more cancer than Second-Hand Smoke. Use the money you were gonna spend on this game and buy The Forest or something.

I do not think I will ever be able to recommend this game unless you enjoy extreme frustration. The concept of the game is great but the execution is the worst I have ever seen. The game's current format is who can be more toxic to the other team or who can exploit the games terrible design the most. The toxicity is a never ending cycle of a killer face camping a survivor so the survivor next game runs him around the map like Usain Bolt and repeat. This would not be a problem if they had the "team" of 4 survivors ranking up or losing rank based on their TEAM performance but currently you will gain little and risk losing a lot if you do work as a team. In terms of bugs and connection problems they are very present. I can't count the number of times where I have stunned the killer with a pallet and still get hit or knocked down. Furthermore there are no dedicated servers but rather killer hosted servers so with that comes a lot of desync/connection issues. This is what you can look forward to but only after you wait 15 minutes to get into a game because of constantly lobby bugs. Spend your money elsewhere.

Jumpscares for days at the beginning, then you get better at reading the maps and the killers. So you gain confidence. Fewer things scare you, except maybe The Doctor because you lose your mind. But you learn. You adapt. You use a brand new part to rush a gen later on.

And then you go up against a Scratched Mirror Myers and you scream like a girl because he pulled you off of the generator because you didn't see him sneaking up behind you. Crap.
Its a crude game visually and mechanically but I love it. It dose not pull punches and reminds you of the horrible world you're in.

This game was a pleasant surprise.  It is surprisingly additcting.  Being able to play as a survivor or a killer prevents the game from getting repetitive.  Tired of getting murdered? Switch to the killer.  Tired of all the survivors getting away?  Switch to a survivor and be the one to escape.  The procedurally generated skills you can unlock also helps create unique characters for each player.

I used to enjoy this game, I really did. I'd rank up, get lots of bloodpoints to spend, and play fairly matched, fun games with people. 

Unfortunately, they changed the ranking system to use emblems, which: a, are unclear in what you have to do in order to get enough points to rank up, and b, are extremely unbalanced on the survivor side. All of the players at low ranks, especially rank 20/19, are absolute trash. It's almost impossible to rank up, because the killers camp everyone to death, can't get anyone on a hook (removing all chance of getting anything for altruism whatsoever), or all of the players quit on you, leaving you with no chance of escape because the gens aren't done yet. There's nothing to stop this from happening. There are no points for having no one be put on the hook. There's no punishment for killers who camp. In fact, they're rewarded, as as long as they can get two people to die, then they pip. There's no punishment either, for teammates that quit once they've been downed twice in a row, because at this stage they are so low in rank that losing two pips for ragequitting doesn't even matter. 

The killers get absolutely overpowered perks, in order to make them still want to play the game. Eg, Hex: No one escapes death - downs survivors in one hit if the gates are open. It boosts killers who aren't very good at all, just because they can knock down a survivor in one hit, put them on the hook, and hit other survivors when they try to save them. 

Basically, if you enjoy laggy servers, garbage teammates, and boosted killers, then totally get this game. If you want to have a good time, play something else. Or wait until the team makes the game better. 

(You may just think I'm salty because I suck at the game. I've always sucked at the game. But now I only play so I can watch myself die over and over. )
